postcontent: For sale are 576 rounds of 9MM ammo. They are packaged in 9, 64 round boxes, 124 grain, boxer primed, non corrosive, copper jacketed reloadable ammunition. The back story of this ammo is it was manufactured in 1955 in the Dominion Arsenal in Canada. It was sold to the CIA which issued the ammo to Central and South American countries the CIA was secretly supporting during the cold war of the 1950's. The ammo was packaged in plain cardboard boxes, 64 rounds per box. The boxes were 64 rounds each as the Sten submachine gun of the Canadian military used 32 round magazines. The rounds per box and manufacture date disguised the fact the CIA was providing ammo for the wars and made it look like Canadian surplus ammo.  The surplus ammo after the cold war was distributed in the US  through Inter Arms Corp. The story is very easy to verify on numerous websites. In addition to having a very interesting history for collectors this ammo is great range ammo.
